content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of approximately 16 building blocks arranged in 3 main layers:
- Bottom layer: Base/foundation with arches and a ramp
- Middle layer: Main body components
- Top layer: Decorative elements and roof structures

## Spatial Relationships
- The base consists of red arch blocks forming a bridge-like structure with an orange ramp on the right side
- On top of the left red arch sits a blue cube with an orange triangular roof
- The middle section contains yellow half-cylinder blocks 
- The right side features an orange cube structure with a triangular roof
- Behind these main elements are green rectangular blocks and yellow tall blocks

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, the following blocks are needed:

1. Block 1 (red arch) - 1 piece
2. Block 2 (red arch) - 2 pieces
3. Block 5 (blue cube) - 1 piece
4. Block 6 (green cube) - 1 piece
5. Block 7 (orange cube) - 1 piece
6. Block 8 (green horizontal rectangle) - 1 piece
7. Block 9 (green vertical rectangle) - 1 piece
8. Block 10 (yellow vertical rectangle) - 2 pieces
9. Block 12 (yellow half-cylinder) - 2 pieces
10. Block 14 (orange triangular roof) - 2 pieces
11. Block 16 (orange ramp) - 1 piece

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 2
    Step4: Move block with index 16
    Step5: Move block with index 5
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 12
    Step8: Move block with index 12
    Step9: Move block with index 14
    Step10: Move block with index 14
    Step11: Move block with index 9
    Step12: Move block with index 8
    Step13: Move block with index 6
    Step14: Move block with index 10
    Step15: Move block with index 10
}
```
